docs.snippet: Floods that destroyed crops and livestock only worsened a crisis that was already under way as a result of successive years of drought and failed harvests in the region....
docs.abstract: Floods that destroyed crops and livestock only worsened a crisis that was already under way as a result of successive years of drought and failed harvests in the region.
docs.lead_paragraph: Torrential rains and flash floods that swept through cities and villages in West Africa in late August have intensified a food crisis in the region, leaving upwards of 10 million people suffering from severe food shortages, the United Nations and relief organizations warned last week.

headline.main: Food Crisis Worsens in West Africa

docs.snippet: Scripps Networks roll out their new programs....
docs.abstract: Scripps Networks roll out their new programs.
docs.lead_paragraph: Among the specialties of Scripps Networks Interactive are cable shows about home renovations, fix-ups and improvements. At their upfront presentation for the 2010-11 season, Scripps executives described some makeover moves of their own.

headline.main: The House Is Filling Up Under the Scripps Networks Roof

docs.snippet: THEODOSA GREEN, 93, or Mother Green to those who know her, often shows up several times a week at the soup kitchen at the Salvation Army center on Nelson Avenue in Peekskill, N.Y. With the help of a home health aide, she walks the few blocks from ...
docs.lead_paragraph: THEODOSA GREEN, 93, or Mother Green to those who know her, often shows up several times a week at the soup kitchen at the Salvation Army center on Nelson Avenue in Peekskill, N.Y. With the help of a home health aide, she walks the few blocks from her apartment to the center to eat lunch.

headline.print_headline: Soup Kitchen in Peekskill Could Close Next Year
headline.seo: Soup Kitchen in Peekskill  Could Close Next Year
headline.main: Soup Kitchen in Peekskill Could Close Next Year

docs.snippet: The Pantry has been dishing up continental breakfasts, lunches, snacks, teas, takeout and deli to discerning residents of Washington Depot and elsewhere in the northwest corner since 1977. A local institution, owned by Michael and Nancy Ackerman s...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Pantry has been dishing up continental breakfasts, lunches, snacks, teas, takeout and deli to discerning residents of Washington Depot and elsewhere in the northwest corner since 1977. A local institution, owned by Michael and Nancy Ackerman since 1987, it has been remarkably consistent throughout its long life — a tiny gem sparkling in the Litchfield Hills, a place where people gather.

docs.snippet: It's all about the beef at the American Burger Company in Huntington, where the walls are inscribed with lists of people who have taken the American Burger Challenge: eating the 4X4 Burger (four cheeseburgers piled on one bun) in one sitting. This...
docs.lead_paragraph: It's all about the beef at the American Burger Company in Huntington, where the walls are inscribed with lists of people who have taken the American Burger Challenge: eating the 4X4 Burger (four cheeseburgers piled on one bun) in one sitting. This red, white and blue burger stand honors the 4X4 champion, Jay (One Gallon) Choi, who got his nickname by eating ice cream and earned his American Burger title by downing six 4X4's in a row. His photo smiles down on customers from a poster hung above the griddle.

docs.snippet: IT was 10 p.m., and Nick Spertos was tending his kebabs as if they were babies in a nursery. Gales of aromatic smoke blew into the night air. A man in a Yankees cap walked up and asked for two chickens....
